title: Spurs waive ex-UWGB star Sykes
text:
Spurs waive ex-UWGB star Sykes Press-Gazette Media 9:06 a.m. CDT October 22, 2015 Buy Photo Former University of Wisconsin-Green Bay point guard Keifer Sykes. (Photo: Evan Siegle/Press-Gazette Media) Buy Photo 
SAN ANTONIO — Keifer Sykes, a rookie point guard who starred at the University of Wisconsin-Green Bay, was one of four players waived Wednesday by the San Antonio Spurs of the NBA. 
Sykes plans to join the Spurs' developmental league team in Austin, Texas, an NBA source told Yahoo reporter Adrian Wojnarowski. Wisconsin-Green Bay's Keifer Sykes, released by San Antonio, plans to join Spurs' D-League affiliate in Austin, league source tells Yahoo. — Adrian Wojnarowski (@WojYahooNBA) October 21, 2015 
The two-time Horizon League player of the year signed a training camp contract with the Spurs in August after playing for the Cleveland Cavaliers in an NBA summer league in July. 
The 5-foot-11 Sykes averaged 9.4 points, 3.4 rebounds and 1.6 assists in five summer league games for Cleveland, shooting 51.4 percent overall and 81.8 percent from the line. 
"I felt my time with the Cavs went really well," Sykes said in August. "I decided to pick the Spurs because they have been interested in me since the pre-draft process. My ultimate goal is to play in the NBA one day, and they want to help me reach that goal. They plan to help me develop until that day comes." 
The Spurs worked out Sykes the day before the NBA draft in June, the last of 18 workouts Sykes had for interested teams. 
The Spurs also waived veteran guard Jimmer Fredette, rookie center Youssou Ndoye and veteran forward Deshaun Thomas to trim their roster to 16 players.
